elements.label: Meteoric Bullet
elements.description: Taenite-iron bullets are occasionally dug from the skeletons of unusual beasts, across Europe, the Middle East and India. Someone has been hunting monsters.

elements.label: Biedde's Blade
elements.description: A cut from this blade will not cease bleeding until the wound is healed. One account has it that Biedde was a knife-collecting surgeon-highwayman in eighteenth-century Toulouse. Another claims Biedde is only the bastardisation of an Arabic word for 'mosquito'.

elements.label: Furious Sliver
elements.description: When the Lionsmith turned against the Colonel, he crushed his own sword in his fist. Each tiniest fragment of that weapon still thrills with rage.

elements.label: Cinnabar Amulet
elements.description: Scarlet is the colour of heat. Mercury holds one key to an ultimate dissolution.

elements.label: Malleus Imperative
elements.description: A tiny ear-bone, blackened by intense heat. Applied correctly, it can crack stone.

elements.label: Carcass Spark
elements.description: A remnant of a greater radiance, glowing softly as decay. Just possibly, a mote of the divided Sun.

elements.label: Whispering Amulet
elements.description: It knows what I desire; or I imagine that it does.

elements.label: Stained Gloves
elements.description: What uses have these known? What lessons might they teach my hands?
elements.comments: Not unique; we can get an extra one from the Dancer legacy.

elements.label: Hallowed Polos
elements.description: The ring-crown of a savage mother, stained with essence, woven with scraps of hair and blessed with flecks of skin.

elements.label: Chalice Murmurous
elements.description: On those nights when we drink from the chalice, we are not certain, afterwards, what we have done. But, we may be assured, it is what always has been done, and if we do not remember, our children will, in their redmost dreams.

elements.label: Marruvine Idol
elements.description: The Marruvii would make little wooden idols to placate the witch-twins they feared in their lake. The lake is almost dry now, but the idols and the witch-twins yet remain, yet shadowed with the aspect of the Heart.
elements.comments: Not unique; we can get an extra one from the Dancer legacy.

elements.label: Wakeful Tympanum
elements.description: In the grove where they flayed the thunder, they rattled their instruments to rouse the frenzy. The power still clings, like scent.

elements.label: Kingskin Bodhrán
elements.description: In the deep forests, the monarch gave up the last thing they had to give, and so the tool was shaped to keep their land forever safe. Then, of course, an empire stole it, as empires do.

elements.label: Icon of St Agnes
elements.description: St Agnes of Bohemia was renowned for her pious dedication to the mortification of the flesh. This icon makes for grisly viewing.

elements.label: Consecrated Lintel
elements.description: This is the skull of a door through which power has passed.

elements.label: Frangiclave
elements.description: There are keys that open doors; then there are keys that destroy them.

elements.label: Noonstone
elements.description: Noon, the saying goes, is not what it was; but this polished stone still retains a sunset glow.
elements.comments: Not unique; we can get multiples if cracked ones are supplied.

elements.label: Wildering Mirror
elements.description: A multiplicity of vistas! A bewilderment of views! Gaze upon me, and rejoice in the dissolution of your senses!
elements.comments: Not unique; we can get multiples if cracked ones are supplied.

elements.label: Watchman's Glass
elements.description: This is the mirror into which one does not look twice.
elements.comments: Not unique; we can get multiples if cracked ones are supplied.

elements.label: Wingèd Doll
elements.description: In an attic above a skeleton house there was a window. Beside the window there was a box. In the box there was a bandage. In the bandage was a twist of clotted hair. In the hair was wound a doll, because the window had never been opened.

elements.label: Dappled Mask
elements.description: In the forest where the moon couldn't go, the boughs of the trees were woven together like bandages or lovers. The moon might change herself to an ant or to a bird or to her sister, but the forest would not yield to her penetrations, no matter her caresses. One day we came with our scissors, and we severed the branches until the moon and the blood dappled the rotting leaves on the forest floor.

elements.label: Alakapurine Shears
elements.description: In the North there is a city of great wealth where dwelt a protector of the world. One day he fell silent. These shears were used to take from him first his hair and then his fingers and then what remained.

elements.label: Paradoxical Curio
elements.description: Sometimes, it is hard to be sure if an arrow slew the Empress Herodias, or the Empress Eudokia. Sometimes, it is possible that an ormolu clock was stolen in the sack of Vienna even as it rested safe in the vaults of Rome.

elements.label: Atlas of Dreams
elements.description: The shape of the world changes in each past, but the shape of the Mansus is reflected in all of them. One cannot map the Mansus, but one can make an attempt to map its reflections.

elements.label: Bone Flute
elements.description: Its sound will cease.

elements.label: Elagabaline Manacle
elements.description: It does not relinquish its grip.

elements.label: Division Bell
elements.description: First, its voice, and after, nothing.

elements.label: Cracked Noonstone
elements.description: Noon, the saying goes, is not what it was; but this stone still retains an embery glow. It has been cracked. A Forge-aspected follower could restore it, with sufficient resources - or I could use up what power remains in it.

elements.label: Cracked Wildering Mirror
elements.description: A deep crack runs across the shimmering metal. A Forge-aspected follower could repair it, with sufficient resources - or I could use up what power remains in it.

elements.label: Cracked Watchman's Glass
elements.description: A Forge-aspected follower could repair it, but the cost would be high - or I could use up what power remains in it.

elements.label: 'Colonel and Lionsmith'
elements.description: Since Issus have they striven so.

elements.label: 'The Forge of Days'
elements.description: If the Forge could regret, it would regret the Intercalate, but in all its other work, it knows joy.

elements.label: 'The Red Grail'
elements.description: She did not split the Sun, but here we might imagine how she must have desired it.

elements.label: 'The Sister-and-Witch'
elements.description: She has been a pair of funeral birds, but here she is as she would wish to drown.

elements.label: 'The Mother of Ants'
elements.description: Even in the days of Elam, she had begun to appear thus.

elements.label: 'The Door in the Eye'
elements.description: He came from the Glory. We cannot help but see.

elements.label: 'The Moth'
elements.description: In the forests of the first continent, our ancestors cursed themselves with their own god.

elements.label: 'Teresa and Christopher'
elements.description: Love, like the Mansus, defies boundaries.

elements.label: 'The Wolf-Divided'
elements.description: CAPUT GERAT LUPINUM. The Sun was divided, and this is its wound.

elements.label: A Pale Canvas
elements.description: I must go very carefully. The memories that I need to convey will take flight from the canvas if I depict them too strongly. I will find those memories in the flesh of the dead... and perhaps even, if I must, in my own dying flesh.

elements.label: The Palest Painting
elements.description: 'Six were lost, thirty remain.' The canvas is not white. Look closely, and see the hinted shapes of the Hours long lost, walking the winding path to the door into Nowhere. Look too closely, and find yourself lost to weeping.
